column4: guys, I experience pretty regular system freezes. Hard freezes... magic sysrq won't even work. Turned off Compiz...the lockups happen much less frequently. Replaced video card, no dice. Replaced RAM, and it seemed to fix if for a few days, but after upgrading to Lucid, seems the lockups are back. Opened case, all fans are working properly. I'm not sure what to do at this point. Could it be the motherboard? Something with Linux itself?
asus motherboard, dual quad core xeons, 12 gb ram
what kind of psu(brand model wattage) and what hardware
we built 12 of them, all running ubuntu. As far as I know, I'm the only one experiening lockups
the only difference between mine and the others is that I have a Netgear WG311T wireless adapter installed
well its not an exceptionally heavy psu for that config but it should be enough
would you think a bad motherboard is a possibility?
for what it's worth, it's much more stable with Compiz disabled for some reason
which is why I tried replacing the Gfx card, but the problem persisted
if you load it heavily without a gui can you make it crash?
if it has an igp can you try using that and remove the gpu/wireless
integrated graphics card on the motherboard
seems odd that lmsensors doesn't support it? yes, I was sad
